channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2023110219
item.description:
Report E-2023110219

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCO experienced a release from (6) 65-pound UN2794, Batteries, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-gallons of battery acid released to a 4’ x 7’ area of the trailer floor due improper loading. Each damaged battery was placed into its own 55-gallon poly drum. A sodium bicarb solution was then utilized to clean the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents, impacted pallet pieces, and PPE were placed into a seventh 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023110167

  • City: WILMINGTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: (1) 55-G drum of Cure Primer Isocyanate fell through a faulty skid and was forked by a forklift operator which released (10) G onto the dock floor near bay door area. The spill was contained and cleaned. All material was placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110323
item.description:
Report E-2023110323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 8, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a faulty pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged 55-gallon drum was containerized into an 85-gallon over-pack. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum, both for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110247
item.description:
Report E-2023110247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) 15-gallon drum containing UN3266 was punctured by a shippers pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, cleaners, and absorbents to remediate the site. All cleanup waste and the damaged container were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110109
item.description:
Report E-2023110109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: IT was reported a 5 gal release of Yellow primer (UN1263) from (1) 5gal metal pail on the trailer. The cause was due to improper loading. The SDS was reviewed with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with oil drip and proper PPE provided by the terminal. The waste was staged into a 25gal poly in the facilities waste area for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110098
item.description:
Report X-2023110098

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was being rts and was repacked into a box instead of a drum. One of the glass bottles broke into pieces causing leakage. Another Bottle had a loose cap, also allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Pads were used soak up the liquid and placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023101471
item.description:
Report X-2023101471

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: SHARONVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WHILE DURING THE TWILIGHT SORT, RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE AT PD3. WHILE WEARING PPE, RESPONDER TESTED LIQUID FOR ITS PH. AFTER TESTING, BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER AND STARED PROCESSING.

item.description:
Report X-2023101470

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DOOR 40 WET AND LEAKING. RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE WAS A CORROSIVE HAZMAT, CONTINUED PROCESSING THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023101443
item.description:
Report X-2023101443

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE SAW LEAKING PACKAGE ON BELT, RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PROPER PPE ON AND GOT THE SPILL CART AND FOLLOWED THE DESCISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CLEANED AND TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP AREA AND FOLLOWED RESPONSE SHEET TO DMP THE PACKAGE.
